alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 1:38AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM PDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southeast California and southern California, including the following counties, in southeast California, Inyo. In southern California, San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 230 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 137 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms has fallen over far southeast Inyo County, and northeast San Bernardino County. Radar estimates localized areas of 1 to 1.5 inches of rain has fallen. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rural areas of far southeast Inyo County and far northeast San Bernardino County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
